articles.title: Assam: 8 illegal Bangladeshis arrested at railway station; Intruders said no guards at border, and we crossed it easily
creator: Dibya Kamal Bordoloi
articles.description: Guwahati: Eight Bangladeshi intruders arrested in Bongaigaon district of Assam have disclosed sensational facts about the porous international border and how infiltrators entered Indian territory. The intruders were arrested on 22nd July in Bongaigaon railway station while trying to board a train said that they had entered India through the Meghlaya border at night. The Bangladeshi intruders entered the Indian territory at the night of July 21 and according to them they crossed the border as there were no guards to prevent them. The fencing in the border also collapsed due to heavy rain and it was easy for them to cross it as there were no guards. The intruders who were arrested by railway police told the media that the barbed wire fencing collapsed due to heavy rain and they easily crossed it to the Indian side as there were no guards. Read More: Bihar electoral revision: ‚ÄúSIR reveals 18 lakh dead, 7 lakh duplicate voters,‚Äù says ECI They were planning to travel to Chennai to work in a garment factory and crossed the international border from Jamalpur in Bangladesh to Meghalaya. One arrested intruder also said that there may be others who have crossed to Indian territory along with them but they were not in their group. The railway police in Bongaigaon station launched a crackdown after a video went viral where dozens of people suspected to be Bangladeshi nationals were seen roaming in the station premises. So far eight intruders have been arrested, but there is fear that many others are still at large who have crossed the porous border. Meanwhile the local police are at high alert. The arrested intruders were questioned by police for further investigation. But it is for sure that the unmanned border in the hilly terrain of Meghalaya are giving opportunities to the infiltrators to easily cross over to the Indian side.

articles.title: A Hellraiser game is in development
creator: Sarah Fielding
articles.description: Calling all gamers with a love of horror films: Hellraiser is getting a video game adaptation. Saber Interactive is turning the cult franchise into a game called Clive Barker‚Äôs Hellraiser: Revival. Clive Baker's 1986 novella, The Hellbound Heart, served as the basis for the Hellraiser films. He also wrote and directed the first instalment, which premiered in 1987. Clive Barker‚Äôs Hellraiser: Revival is a single-player game that has you play as Aidan while fighting your way through an "action survival horror experience." You also must deal with Pinhead, who's known for harvesting human souls ‚Äî yeah, this is a creepy game. As Saber Interactive states, "The Hellraiser universe is defined by its unflinching exploration of pain, pleasure, and the thin and terrifying line that separates the two. That essence is at the heart of our game." You can see for yourself in the announcement trailer.The team at Saber Interactive took an additional step to ensure fans of the movie franchise are happy. They spoke with Clive Barker, himself, to maintain an "authentic" storyline. There's no word yet on exactly when Clive Barker‚Äôs Hellraiser: Revival will launch, but more announcements should come this year. It will be available on theXbox Series X and S, PlayStation 5, and the PC through Steam. This article originally appeared on Engadget at https://www.engadget.com/gaming/playstation/a-hellraiser-game-is-in-development-145313443.html?src=rss

articles.title: Devendra Fadnavis: The Relentless Rise Of Maharashtra‚Äôs Political Strategist
creator: Tarannum Manjul
articles.description: On July 22, as Devendra Fadnavis turns 55, Maharashtra pauses to acknowledge the journey of a leader who has reshaped the state‚Äôs political contours in the past decade. More than just the Bharatiya Janata Party‚Äôs (BJP) face in Maharashtra, Fadnavis has grown to embody the party‚Äôs aspirations, adaptability, and power play in one of India‚Äôs most politically complex states.This is not merely a birthday tribute, but a tracing of the arc of a man who went from being the youngest mayor of Nagpur to a two-time Chief Minister of Maharashtra, deftly navigating caste equations, coalition politics, and the pressures of urban governance with trademark resilience. The Early Years: Political Roots in the RSS EcosystemBorn in Nagpur in 1970 into a Brahmin family with strong ties to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), Devendra Fadnavis was steeped in political ideology from a young age. His father, Gangadhar Fadnavis, was a prominent member of the Jan Sangh and later the BJP, offering young Devendra an early glimpse into the world of public life.A law graduate with a management degree, Fadnavis entered electoral politics early. By 22, he was a municipal corporator in Nagpur, and soon after, in 1997, he became the city‚Äôs youngest mayor at age 27 ‚Äî a precursor to his rapid political ascent. Legislative Journey: The MLA with a Technocrat‚Äôs MindFirst elected as an MLA from Nagpur West in 1999, and then continuously re-elected from Nagpur South West, Fadnavis quickly established a reputation as a policy-oriented, articulate leader. Whether it was debating urban renewal, fiscal discipline or infrastructure modernisation, he often stood out in the Maharashtra Assembly for his sharp grasp of governance.His stint as state BJP president from 2013‚Äì14 positioned him as a frontrunner in the party‚Äôs push to dislodge the Congress-NCP regime. The 2014 Breakthrough: Maharashtra‚Äôs First BJP CM Without CoalitionIn 2014, riding on the Narendra Modi wave and BJP‚Äôs national resurgence, Fadnavis became Maharashtra‚Äôs first BJP Chief Minister to complete a full five-year term, a feat in a state known for political churn. At 44, he was the second youngest CM after Sharad Pawar and the first from Nagpur ‚Äî the ideological nerve centre of the RSS.His selection surprised many, including regional power centres within the party, but the high command favoured his clean image, technocratic credentials, and urban connect. The decision proved strategic, with Fadnavis becoming the BJP‚Äôs face of governance and modernisation in Maharashtra. The First Term (2014‚Äì2019): Infrastructure, Investment, and Assertive LeadershipAs Chief Minister, Fadnavis pushed an aggressive development agenda. Under his leadership the Mumbai Metro projects gained momentum, the ambitious Samruddhi Mahamarg (Nagpur-Mumbai Expressway) was fast-tracked, ease of doing business rankings improved significantly, the state attracted record foreign direct investment (FDI), urban projects such as the Smart Cities Mission saw active promotion.He also made decisive interventions during droughts, with initiatives like the Jalyukt Shivar Abhiyan to combat water scarcity.Yet, his assertiveness often came with political cost ‚Äî particularly in rural Maharashtra and with ally Shiv Sena, with whom relations grew increasingly tense. 2019: A Brief Second Stint and a Political ThrillerThe 2019 assembly elections delivered a fractured verdict. Although the BJP emerged as the largest party, its alliance with the Shiv Sena unravelled dramatically over the CM post. In a twist that gripped the nation, Fadnavis returned for just 80 hours as CM, in a short-lived coalition with Ajit Pawar of the NCP, before the alliance collapsed.It was a rare political miscalculation for a leader known for backroom mastery. But it also paved the way for the formation of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government ‚Äî an unlikely coalition of Shiv Sena (Uddhav), NCP, and Congress. The Role of a Relentless Leader (2020‚Äì2022): Shadow CM and StrategistOut of power but not out of relevance, Fadnavis transformed into a hyper-active Leader of Opposition. From exposing alleged corruption in the MVA regime to taking legal battles to the courts, he ensured that the BJP stayed centre-stage even without formal authority.Political observers often referred to him as the ‚ÄúShadow CM,‚Äù with his relentless campaigning, cadre mobilisation, and continued access to national leadership. 2022 and Beyond: Return to Government as Deputy CMIn June 2022, Maharashtra‚Äôs politics turned on its head again when Eknath Shinde led a factional split in Shiv Sena, toppling the MVA. In a move that showcased both humility and strategic acumen, Fadnavis agreed to be Deputy Chief Minister under Shinde ‚Äî a role he embraced with energy.He has overseen Home, Finance, and Urban Development portfolios, continuing to wield immense administrative influence. A New Chapter: Back at the Helm as Chief MinisterIn 2024, following a series of electoral victories and internal recalibrations within the MahaYuti alliance, Devendra Fadnavis was sworn in once again as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra. His return to the top post underscored his enduring relevance and the BJP‚Äôs confidence in his administrative and political capabilities. Now leading a government with Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar as key allies, Fadnavis faces the complex challenge of balancing coalition dynamics while pushing forward an ambitious agenda of infrastructure growth, investor confidence, and social welfare. As CM, he has prioritised law and order reforms, youth skilling initiatives, and urban transformation projects like the Mumbai Metro and Pune Ring Road, reaffirming his position as a moderniser with a mass connect. The Brand Fadnavis: Technocrat, Tactician, Team PlayerToday, Devendra Fadnavis stands as a rare blend of technocrat and tactician. Fluent in Marathi, English and Hindi, he connects with multiple demographics ‚Äî from urban youth to rural karyakartas.He remains a core member of BJP‚Äôs national strategy team, often parachuted into other states for election management. In Maharashtra, he is both the architect and the face of the BJP‚Äôs long-term plans to establish full dominance.He has weathered political storms, criticism, caste complexities, coalition compulsions, and yet retains the party‚Äôs trust ‚Äî a testament to his adaptive leadership style.As BW Businessworld wishes him on his 55th birthday, the legacy of Devendra Fadnavis is not just in the positions he has held, but in how he has changed the rules of Maharashtra‚Äôs political game ‚Äî with patience, persistence, and purpose.

articles.title: ED‚Äôs Money Laundering Charges Against Chanda Kochhar Upheld By SAFEMA Tribunal
creator: ANI
articles.description: In the ICICI Bank-Videocon loan matter, the Appellate Tribunal under the Smugglers and Foreign Exchange Manipulators (Forfeiture of Property) Act (SAFEMA) has found former ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar guilty of accepting a ‚Çπ64 crore bribe in return for sanctioning a ‚Çπ300 crore loan to the Videocon Group in 2009.This order overturns the earlier clean chit she received from the PMLA Adjudicating Authority and supports the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) provisional attachment of her assets, framing the transaction as a prima facie case of money laundering.The Tribunal underscored a clear conflict of interest in Kochhar's approval of the loan. Shortly after disbursing the funds to a Videocon entity, ‚Çπ64 crore was traced to NuPower Renewables Pvt. Ltd. (NRPL), a company promoted by her husband Deepak Kochhar. This sum was funneled via Supreme Energy Pvt. Ltd. (SEPL), which is reportedly linked to Videocon's promoter Venugopal Dhoot. While the Tribunal acknowledged that a final determination rests with the Trial Court, it concluded there was sufficient preliminary evidence to justify the attachment order under money laundering charges.Also Read : Tariff Tensions Escalate: India‚ÄìUS Interim Deal Unlikely Before Deadline, Says ReportThe bench of the Appellate Tribunal, while delivering its findings, stated that it could not accept the justification offered by Chanda Kochhar for presiding over the committee meeting that sanctioned a ‚Çπ300 crore loan to the Videocon Group -- an entity she was familiar with. The tribunal observed that Kochhar could not claim ignorance of the relationship and, therefore, her participation in the loan sanctioning process was in clear violation of ICICI Bank's internal rules and policies.The tribunal further noted that immediately after the disbursement of the ‚Çπ300 crore loan, a sum of ‚Çπ64 crore was diverted to NuPower Renewables Pvt. Ltd. (NRPL), where Deepak Kochhar, the respondent and husband of Chanda Kochhar, was managing the company. He held 95% stakes in Supreme Energy Pvt. Ltd. (SEPL), which in turn controlled NRPL. Notably, V.N. Dhoot resigned from SEPL on January 15, 2009, transferring control of the company to Deepak Kochhar.In its order, the tribunal criticized the Adjudicating Authority for ignoring key material evidence and instead relying on irrelevant considerations. It emphasized that the Authority had disproportionately focused on the shareholding structure of NRPL while overlooking the fact that Deepak Kochhar was the Managing Director and in full control of the company's operations. This was further supported by the statement of V.N. Dhoot recorded under Section 50 of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002, wherein he categorically affirmed that Deepak Kochhar was running the affairs of the company.In January 2020, the ED initially attached assets worth ‚Çπ78 crore belonging to the Kochhars, a decision that was reversed by the PMLA Adjudicating Authority in November the same year. The Appellate Tribunal's latest ruling reinstates the ED's position.Deepak Kochhar was arrested by the ED in September 2020 and later released on bail. In December 2022, both Chanda and Deepak Kochhar were arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), only to be granted interim bail by the Bombay High Court in January 2023. The High Court, in a landmark judgment in February 2024, deemed their arrest unlawful and an abuse of power. (This report has been published as part of the auto-generated syndicate wire feed. Apart from the headline, no editing has been done in the copy by ABP Live.)

articles.title: Europe trip to soon cost more for some
articles.description: Starting late 2026, visa-free travelers heading to Europe will need to pay more to enter. The European Commission has proposed raising the European Travel Information and Authorization System (ETIAS) fee from ‚Ç¨7 to ‚Ç¨20. This nearly threefold increase will affect citizens from more than 60 non-EU countries that currently enjoy visa-free access to the Schengen zone, including the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, Japan‚Äîand Indian passport holders who hold long-term visas or residence in these countries. Visa-Free, Not Cost-Free Once operational, ETIAS will require all travelers from visa-exempt countries to apply online before visiting any of the 30 European countries under the Schengen Agreement. This includes Indians living in or holding visas for countries such as the US, UK, or Canada. The updated fee structure is part of a broader push by the EU to align ETIAS with global counterparts such as the US Electronic System for Travel Authorization (ESTA) and the UK‚Äôs Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA). According to the European Commission, the ‚Ç¨20 fee will help finance system operations, upgrades in security infrastructure, and integration with databases such as Interpol and Europol. Application Remains Digital The application process remains simple. Travelers will need to fill out an online form with their personal details and passport information. The system will then automatically screen the information for security, health, and migration concerns. Most approvals are expected within minutes, though applications flagged for review may take longer. There is no need to visit a consulate, and the travel authorisation is valid for multiple short-term stays over a three-year period or until the passport expires, whichever comes first. Who Is Exempt Not every traveler will be affected by the price hike. Children under 18, adults over 70, and certain family members of EU citizens will remain exempt from paying the fee. Non-EU nationals who hold free movement rights within the bloc are also not required to pay. Review and Implementation Timeline The European Council and Parliament now have a two-month window to review the proposal. If no objections or changes are made during this period, the new fee will be implemented alongside the full launch of ETIAS, expected in the final quarter of 2026. EU Cites Security and Parity ‚ÄúThe new fee structure brings ETIAS in line with similar systems in other major travel destinations and ensures long-term maintenance and security of the system,‚Äù the Commission noted. ETIAS is being positioned as a key component in the EU‚Äôs effort to digitise border checks and bolster public safety while maintaining ease of travel for tourists and short-term visitors. Until the system goes live, travelers to Europe from visa-exempt countries, including Indians holding US, UK, or Schengen long-stay visas, will continue to enter the region without paying the higher fee. But from late 2026, budgeting for ETIAS will become a part of the pre-departure checklist.116163879

articles.title: Garena Free Fire Max Codes (July 22): Grab Exclusive Loot, Rewards Before Others Claim Them! Here's How
creator: ABP Live Tech
articles.description: Garena Free Fire Max redeem codes for today: Garena Free Fire Max fans have a new reason to log in today. A fresh batch of redeem codes has just dropped, offering players a chance to grab exclusive in-game items for free, but only if they act fast. As has become tradition, 111 Dot Studios, the developer behind the game, has released a set of alphanumeric codes that unlock premium collectibles, ranging from weapon skins to the ever-popular Diamond Vouchers.This daily drop of freebies is part of the studio's ongoing strategy to keep its battle royale title buzzing with activity, especially after the original Garena Free Fire was banned in India back in 2022. The Max version, with its richer graphics and improved gameplay, has since filled the void, winning over a loyal Indian fanbase.Limited Redemptions, High StakesThe catch? These redemption codes are highly time-sensitive and limited in quantity. Only the first 500 users each day can claim the rewards, and each code is valid for just 12 hours. That scarcity has turned the daily redemption ritual into a digital stampede.Among today‚Äôs hottest rewards are the Rebel Academy and Revolt Weapon Loot Crates, along with the highly coveted Fire Head Hunting Parachute. Garena has also thrown in Diamond Vouchers, making today‚Äôs codes some of the most desirable in recent memory.How to claim your Garena Free Fire Max lootTo grab the rewards, players need to visit the official Rewards Redemption Site and log in using Facebook, Google, X, or VK credentials. After that, it‚Äôs a simple copy-paste job; players enter the 12-character codes into the text box, hit confirm, and wait for the goodies to show up in their in-game mailbox.Currency rewards like gold or diamonds are directly credited to the player's wallet.Garena Free Fire Max Redeem Codes Today (July 22)Here‚Äôs a look at today‚Äôs Garena Free Fire Max redeem codes for July 22, 2025:FFRPXQ3KMGT9FVTXQ5KMFLPZFFNFSXTPQML2RDNAFV7KXTQ4FFMTYQPXFGX6FF6WXQ9STKY3FFRSX4CYHXZ8NPTF2FWXPLV7FFDMNQX9KGX2FFCBRX7QTSL4FFSGT9KNQXT6FPSTX9MKNLY5XF4S9KCW7KY2FFEV4SQPFKX9FFPURTXQFKX3FFNGYZPPKNLX7FFYNCXG2FNT4FPUSG9XQTLMYFFKSY9PQLWX5FFNFSXTPVQZ7GXFT9YNWLQZ3FFM4X9HQWLM5While many gamers are already sharing their rewards on social media, others are still scrambling to grab theirs before the clock runs out. The urgency is part of the appeal, and Garena knows it. By gamifying the very act of claiming free items, the developers have found a clever way to keep the community engaged day after day.For dedicated players, it‚Äôs become more than a routine; it‚Äôs a race.

articles.description: At the edge of Arunachal Pradesh, in Zemithang ‚Äî the same border region from where the Dalai Lama first entered India ‚Äî plastic waste has become an unexpected threat. Through projects like Zemithang Diaries and The Batti Project, they‚Äôve built a powerful model of change: empowering local communities to tackle waste on their own terms. articles.title: Blinkit beats Zomato in NOV terms: 10 key takeaways from Eternal Q1 results
creator: Binu Mathew
articles.description: Reflecting explosive growth potential in the quick commerce business, Blinkit‚Äôs net order value (NOV) surpassed that of Zomato‚Äôs food delivery platform for the first time in Eternal‚Äôs history. In its Q1 results, Eternal reported Blinkit‚Äôs NOV grew 127% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 9,203 crore, eclipsing Zomato‚Äôs Rs 8,967 crore. While food delivery NOV growth slowed to 13% YoY from 14%, Blinkit posted 25% sequential growth. As a result, the stock ended over 5% higher at Rs 271.20 on the BSE.

articles.title: Rapid test kits for Hepatitis B, Sickle cell anemia to be available at PHCs, government decides
creator: Durgesh Nandan Jha
articles.description: To facilitate early detection and treatment, the ICMR suggests making rapid diagnostic tests for diseases like Hepatitis B and sickle cell anemia available at rural health centers, including Ayushman Arogya Mandirs. The updated National Essential Diagnostics List (NEDL) aims to decentralize testing, eliminating the need for sample transfers to hubs. This revision follows extensive consultations with stakeholders and experts.

articles.title: Who will become the next Vice President of India after Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation?
articles.description: Who will be next Vice President?: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on Monday citing medical advice, with immediate effect. In his letter to President Droupadi Murmu, he thanked her, the Prime Minister, and the Council of Ministers. The Constitution provides no clarity on succession, but during a vacancy, the Deputy Chairperson or a Rajya Sabha member authorised by the President discharges the Vice-President‚Äôs duties as Rajya Sabha Chairperson.

articles.title: "No One Is Above Law" Trump Posts AI Video Of Obama's 'Arrest' Amid 2016 Election 'Fraud' Claims
creator: News18
articles.description: President Donald Trump stepped up his attack on Barack Obama by posting an AI-generated video of the FBI arresting the former President in the Oval Office. The video begins with Obama saying, "especially the President is above the law". It then features many US politicians stating, "no one is above the law." The clip then switches to an AI-generated video of Obama being handcuffed by two FBI agents in the same office he once occupied as the President. Trump can be seen sitting and smiling during the "arrest". The fake video ends with Obama standing inside jail, wearing the prison's orange jumpsuit. This controversial video comes days after the Trump administration accused Obama of a "high-level election fraud" in 2016. n18oc_world n18oc_crux

articles.title: CBSE Mandates CCTV Cameras In Schools With Real-Time Recording For Students' Safety
creator: PTI
articles.description: New Delhi, Jul 21 (PTI) The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has amended affiliation norms to mandate schools to install CCTV cameras with real-time audio-visual recording at all places other than toilets, an official said on Monday."Safety of students is one of the paramount responsibilities of a school and ensure that the students get a safe and cohesive eco-system in the school. The Safety has two aspects- (a) safety from scrupulous unsocietal elements (b) safety for the overall well-being of the children with reference to bullying and other implicit threats."All of such probablities can be prevented with a vigilant and sensitive staff and with the usage of the latest technology," CBSE Secretary Himanshu Gupta said.To ensure the safety of students in the school premises, the board has made an amendment in Chapter 4 (Physical Infrastructure) of Affiliation Bye Laws-2018 by incorporating a clause about CCTV installation."The school should install high resolution CCTV Cameras with audio visual facility at all the entry and exit points of the school, lobbies, corridors, Staircases, all the classrooms, labs, library, canteen area, store room, playground and other common areas except toilets and washrooms with real time audiovisual recording."These CCTV Cameras must be equipped with a storage device with the capacity of holding footage of at-least 15 days. It shall be ensured that a backup of a minimum 15 days be preserved, which may be accessed by the authorities, if required," Gupta added.As per the Manual on Safety and Security of Children in Schools, NCPCR, "School Safety" has been defined as creating a safe environment for children, starting from their homes to their schools and back."This includes safety from any kind of abuse, violence, psycho-social issue, disaster: natural and man made, fire, transportation. Emotional safety is especially important because it is often difficult for teachers and parents to detect emotional problems and difficulties in children."Bullying can cause victimized students to suffer from lower self-esteem and daily stress about their well-being," Gupta said. (This report has been published as part of the auto-generated syndicate wire feed. Apart from the headline, no editing has been done in the copy by ABP Live.)

articles.title: Assam: Major infrastructure project under Modi govt to deliver second rail road bridge over Brahmaputra in Guwahati
creator: Dibya Kamal Bordoloi
articles.description: The railway passengers from the Northeast will have much faster connectivity with other Indian states after the announcement of a second railway bridge over the Brahmaputra in Guwahati. The Second Rail-cum-Road Bridge at Saraighat over the Brahmaputra River has been sanctioned as part of the doubling of the Agthori‚ÄìKamakhya railway line under Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR). This major infrastructure project was sanctioned during the FY 2023‚Äì24 with a sanctioned estimate of Rs. 1,473.77 crore, and is targeted for completion by December 2029. Also Read: PM Modi to visit UK and Maldives for high-level bilateral meetings from July 23 to 26, aiming to boost trade As part of the progress, detailed estimates have been sanctioned by the Railway Board in February 2024, and the Design Drawing & Report has been finalised and duly approved by the competent authority in March 2025. The geotechnical investigations have been completed for the design of the substructure & superstructure, and an EPC tender has been floated for the construction of the bridge, including approach roads, rail viaducts, earthwork and ancillary works. The tender is expected to be finalised soon, and construction works will start immediately after the same. The project includes the construction of a 7.062 km-long stretch from Agthori to Kamakhya, featuring a 1.3 km-long steel composite girder bridge over the Brahmaputra River. The upcoming bridge will be designed with a double-line railway track on the lower deck and a three-lane roadway with footpaths on the upper deck. The north-end approach of 2.694 km will connect to Agthori station, while the south-end approach of 3.07 km will connect to Kamakhya station. Once completed, the new bridge will significantly enhance line capacity in the section, which is poised for industrial growth. Besides improving connectivity, the project is expected to create substantial employment opportunities for both skilled and unskilled workers in the surrounding areas. The Saraighat Bridge is the first rail-cum-road bridge of the region over the river Brahmaputra in Guwahati. The construction of the steel bridge started in 1958 and has been serving the people of the region and the nation since 1962.

articles.title: Nokia-Maker HMD Tipped To Be Working On Pulse 2, Crest 2, Bold Series Of Phones: What We Know So Far
creator: Shayak Majumder
articles.description: HMD Global, the manufacturer of Nokia-branded phones, is gearing up for a busy season in the budget smartphone segment, with leaks pointing to not just one or two, but a full lineup of affordable devices on the horizon. Leading the charge is the upcoming Pulse 2 series, comprising the HMD Pulse 2, Pulse 2 Plus, and Pulse 2 Pro. According to tipster HMD MEME‚ÄôS, all three phones will run Android 15 out of the box and feature Unisoc processors, marking a renewed push into the entry-level Android market.HMD "ACCORD"- Unisoc T8300U 5G SoC- 4, 6, 8GB of RAMHMD "MAHUZE"- Unisoc T7250 SoC- 4, 6 GB of RAM‚Äî HMD_MEME'S (@smashx_60) July 19, 2025The base model, HMD Pulse 2, is tipped to sport a 6.67-inch HD+ IPS LCD display with a 90Hz refresh rate. Under the hood, it could house a Unisoc T7200 processor, paired with 4GB RAM and up to 128GB of storage. The camera setup is expected to be modest, with a 13MP main sensor and an 8MP front-facing camera for selfies.Meanwhile, the Pulse 2 Plus sticks with the same display and chipset but brings a 50MP main rear camera for improved imaging. RAM is bumped up to 6GB, and storage options remain at 64GB and 128GB.Pulse 2 Pro Aims Higher With 120Hz Display and 50MP Front CameraAt the top end of the new trio is the HMD Pulse 2 Pro, which appears to offer a few premium touches while staying within budget territory. It‚Äôs likely to include a 6.7-inch HD+ LCD with a smoother 120Hz refresh rate, a Unisoc T7250 processor, and either 6GB or 8GB RAM, alongside up to 256GB of storage. Fast charging support is also expected at 20W.The camera department is where the Pulse 2 Pro could shine. The rear setup reportedly adds a macro and depth sensor alongside a 50MP primary camera, while the front camera is also a 50MP shooter, an unusual spec at this price point.Crest 2 and Bold Also in the Works With Unisoc PowerIn addition to the Pulse 2 series, two other phones are believed to be on the way: the HMD Crest 2 and the HMD Bold. Internally codenamed ‚ÄúACCORD‚Äù and ‚ÄúMAHUZE‚Äù respectively, these models appear to be targeting slightly different ends of the budget spectrum.The HMD Crest 2 is expected to be the more powerful of the two, equipped with the Unisoc T8300 5G chipset. Built on TSMC‚Äôs 6nm process, this chip includes two Cortex-A78 cores at 2.2GHz and six Cortex-A55 efficiency cores at 2.0GHz. Geekbench results show a single-core score of 743 and a multi-core score of 2285, which should deliver decent day-to-day performance for a budget 5G phone. RAM variants could include 4GB, 6GB, and even 8GB.On the other hand, the HMD Bold is likely to feature the Unisoc T7250 processor, based on a 12nm FinFET design. It includes two Cortex-A75 cores at 1.8GHz and six Cortex-A55 cores at 1.6GHz. This model is expected to come with 4GB or 6GB of RAM.No Word Yet on Pricing or Launch DatesThere is no official confirmation from HMD about the release dates or pricing of these upcoming phones. However, with multiple leaks emerging in quick succession, a formal announcement could be around the corner. One thing is clear: HMD is preparing to flood the budget market with options that blend modern specs and affordable price points.

creator: Gargi Gaur
articles.description: A groundbreaking study published in Environmental Science and Ecotechnology highlights the urgent need to address hidden chemical pollution threatening ecosystems. With over 350,000 synthetic chemicals in use and production set to triple by 2050, researchers propose a four-step framework using eDNA, AI, and remote sensing to detect early warning signs of ecological distress. This approach aims to prevent biodiversity collapse by integrating real-time monitoring and regulatory reform.

articles.description: South Indian Bank declared net profit of Rs. 321.95 Cr. for the FY Q1 2025-26 registering a growth of 9.46% compared to Rs. 294.13 Cr. in Q1 FY 2024-25. BankHighest ever Provision Coverage Ratio (including write off) of 88.82% Reduced Net NPA to 0.68%Key HighlightsOperating Profit of the quarter increased by 32.41% from Rs. 507.68 Cr. in Q1 FY 25 to
